answerText: deep inelastic scattering[10] Feynman and Bjorken introduced this model of hadrons to account for the results of the SLAC-MIT deep inelastic scattering experiments. It suppose that at high energies, hadrons are composed of many point-like particles.

question: Question:  [10] Name this technique used to explore the insides of hadrons by hitting them with extremely high energy leptons.
